abstract.text: Simulate and render 3D content for use in your augmented reality apps.
An ordered, mutable collection of entities.
A representation of a physical object that RealityKit renders and optionally
simulates.
A view that contains RealityKit content.
The type of view representing the body of this view.
The content and behavior of the view.
Creates a reality view for iOS and macOS, with
an optional update closure.
Creates a new reality view for visionOS with
an optional update closure.
Creates a reality view for visionOS, with attachments
and an optional update closure.
Creates a new reality view for visionOS with
an optional update closure
and placeholder view.
Creates a reality view for iOS and macOS, with
an optional update closure
and placeholder view.
Creates a reality view for visionOS, with attachments,
an optional update closure,
and placeholder view.
The content of a reality view that is displayed through a camera.
The content of a visionOS reality view.
A protocol representing the content of a reality view.
A view that represents the default placeholder for a RealityView.
A collection of entities in a RealityView.
Detect objects in an AR scene or create a detailed 3D reconstruction of the real-world environment.

doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation.title: Implementing scene understanding and reconstruction in your RealityKit app

abstract.text: A type that represents part of your app’s user interface and provides modifiers that you use to configure views.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
